name: "Magnum P.I." DVD Season One Quiz | Magnum P.I. | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Hawaii.

	The taping of "Magnum P.I." was based in Oahu, Hawaii. There were fifty special guest stars that played on "Magnum P.I." in the eight years it was on CBS. In the eight years the show was on the air, there were two crossovers with other CBS crime dramas.

questions.text: In the bonus disc of the season one DVD, which crime drama shared a crossover with "Magnum P.I." (hint: the episode was from season 3)?
questions.explanation:
Simon & Simon.

	On the fourth disc of the season one DVD of "Magnum P.I.", the two-part crossover began with the season three episode "Ki'i's Don't Lie" and ended with the season two premiere of the "Simon & Simon" episode "Emeralds Are Not A Girl's Best Friend". Morgan Fairchild guest starred in both episodes.

questions.text: In the episode "Adelaide", who (or what) was Magnum being paid to protect?
options: Zeus and Apollo's female dog friend
questions.explanation:
Horse.

	Adelaide was the name of the woman who owned a horse named Norman. Magnum was paid to protect Norman until he could compete in a competition.

questions.text: In "Thank Heaven for Little Girls and Big Ones Too", who did Magnum say painted the portrait that was hanging above the mantle in Robin's living room?
questions.explanation:
Gauguin.

	The painting Higgins had hanging in Robin's living room was painted by Gauguin, according to Magnum. The young girls that Magnum had taken as clients were going to steal the painting and replace it with the original because it turned out Higgins had the forgery.

questions.text: Who manages the King Kamehameha club?
questions.explanation:
Rick.

	Higgins gave Rick the job of manager of the King Kamehameha club. It's an exclusive club for members and their visitors. Magnum and T.C. hang out there with Rick even though neither of them go by the dress code that was established for the club.

questions.text: The fifth season episode "Echoes of the Mind" was on the bonus disc of the season one DVD. Which famous actress played Diane and Deidre Dupres?
questions.explanation:
Sharon Stone.

	Sharon Stone played a woman with a split personality that Magnum fell in love with. The bonus disc showed the full two hour episode which ended with Diane committing suicide in front of Magnum.

questions.text: When Magnum was first shown, what was he doing?
options: Racing another car in the Ferrari
Running away from Zeus and Apollo
Taking a nap on the beach
questions.explanation:
Breaking into Robin's Nest.

	Thomas Magnum was first seen breaking into Robin's Nest to check security in "Don't Eat the Snow in Hawaii". He made it clear to the viewing audience through a voice over that he lived at Robin's Nest and was just checking security. Of course, Zeus and Apollo went after him as usual.

questions.text: In "J. Digger Doyle", who voiced the role of Robin Masters?
questions.explanation:
Orson Welles.

	Orson Welles was heard, but never seen, in this monumental episode in which Robin Masters is actually shown as being a real person. Before this episode, Robin was only a name or a person on the other end of the phone that was never heard.

questions.text: What is the missing word in the episode title, "The Ugliest ___ in Hawaii"?
questions.explanation:
Dog.

	"The Ugliest Dog in Hawaii" was named Sir Algernon Farnsworth and turned out to be the former dog of a mobster. Sir Algernon had a tattoo of the numbers for a Swiss bank account on his hip and was subjected to many kidnapping attempts in order to retrieve the tattoo. In the end, the tattoo was removed from the dog and Sir Algernon spent the rest of his quarantine at Robin's Nest, much to Higgins' chagrin.

questions.text: And, last but not least, who played the infamous Hawaiian private investigator, Thomas Sullivan Magnum IV?
questions.explanation:
Tom Selleck.

	Tom Selleck gave up the job of Indiana Jones to portray Thomas Magnum in the eight season run of "Magnum P.I.". "Magnum P.I." was the first TV series he acted in as the major character.
